title: How to Clean Orange Stains in a Shower

steps.title: Try scrubbing with water and a rough sponge.
steps.content: Try scrubbing with water and a rough sponge. If you do not have aggressive stains, or the stains are relatively new, you may be able to remove soap buildup that has become stained with a rough sponge, water, and vigorous scrubbing. Do not scrub so hard that you damage the finishing of your shower or tub, as this will create a texture that is harder to clean.

steps.title: Use a lemon juice and water solution.
steps.content: Use a lemon juice and water solution. Squeeze the juice of a lemon into a spray bottle, and fill the rest of the spray bottle with water. Spray the solution onto your stains, and let it stay for 10 minutes before wiping it down. Repeat as necessary.

steps.title: Use a paste made from white vinegar and baking soda.
steps.content: Use a paste made from white vinegar and baking soda. Dry the stain, then spread the mixture over it and allow it to sit for 15 minutes before scrubbing lightly with a cloth. [2] X Research source Dry the area well.

steps.title: Use a paste made from hot water and borax.
steps.content: Use a paste made from hot water and borax. Borax, a mineral and salt that comes from boric acid, is available in powder form at hardware and grocery stores, as well as online. Create a paste with 1 tablespoon of borax and two cups of hot water. Apply to the stain and let it sit overnight before rubbing it off with a cloth. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Try rubbing with a wet Mr.
steps.content: Try rubbing with a wet Mr. Clean Magic Eraser. Mr. Clean Magic Eraser is a cleaning product made with chemicals (melamine, formaldehyde and sodium bisulfate). Saturate the eraser with water to activate the chemicals, squeeze it onto the stain, then rub in gentle, circular motions. Rinse with more water. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Use a cleaner with oxalic acid.
steps.content: Use a cleaner with oxalic acid. Although oxalic acid is found in nature, it is poisonous and harsh, so make sure to fully rinse the product off with water, and avoid these cleaners if you have a septic tank. Most oxalic acid cleaners, like “ZUD” require that you let the solution sit for 1 to 1 and ½ hours before rubbing and rinsing it away. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Use a cleaner with hydrochloric acid.
steps.content: Use a cleaner with hydrochloric acid. Different products will have different amounts of hydrochloric acid in them. Look for a product with about 20% hydrochloric acid, like The Works. Spray and let sit according to the products directions. Alternatively, you can put some Bar Keepers Friend Soft Cleanser. [6] X Expert Source Erik Bakirov Cleaning Specialist Expert Interview. 7 January 2021. Then scrub with a zero-grade metal sponge that is usually used for glass. [7] X Expert Source Erik Bakirov Cleaning Specialist Expert Interview. 7 January 2021. Or use a professional kit for stain removing that is available online. [8] X Expert Source Erik Bakirov Cleaning Specialist Expert Interview. 7 January 2021.

steps.title: Wipe the shower dry after use.
steps.content: Wipe the shower dry after use. This will prevent mineral buildup on the moisture and soap scum in your shower.

steps.title: Use products specifically made to prevent iron stains stains.
steps.content: Use products specifically made to prevent iron stains stains. Products like Iron Out claim to not only fight iron stains, but also to prevent stains when used as a regular cleaning product.

steps.title: Use a liquid or powder water softener in your washing machine.
steps.content: Use a liquid or powder water softener in your washing machine. If used in your washing machine, these products will hopefully enter your entire water system, and lessen the minerals in your water. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Purchase a water softener system, or an iron filter.
steps.content: Purchase a water softener system, or an iron filter. Both of these products are tanks installed in your plumbing. A water softener system will use salt or potassium-chloride to mix other minerals into your water and reduce the concentration of stain-causing iron and magnesium. [10] X Research source An iron filter filters out the iron and magnesium in your water without adding any other compounds, and only needs to be replaced about every 10 years. [11] X Research source
